title: What is a hackathon?
content: hackathon is an invention marathon. Students come together to build cool software & hardware hacks over 12 hours. [Itâ€™s very beginner friendly.](https://medium.com/@tfogo/hackathons-are-for-beginners-77a9c9c0e000#.tehddtopz)

title: How much does it cost?
content: Nothing. Attending a hackathon is free.

title: Do I need to be a student to attend?
content: Yes. Only students who are currently enrolled at a college/university or have graduated within the past 12 months are eligible to attend.

title: Where is the event?
content: The event is being hosted at [The Curzon Building, Birmingham City University](https://goo.gl/maps/ZqjZf8XE8SL2). Click the link for a Google map.

title: What is Major League Hacking?
content: Major League Hacking is the official student hackathon league in North America & Europe. They work with over 200 Member Events and empower over 70,000 students every year.

title: Is there a code of conduct?
content: Yes there is. We enforce it very strongly. You can find it [here](https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf).
